Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Character

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Character
All Implemented Interfaces:
Jsonable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionPhaseTest.MockHerbalist, Bard, CharacterTest.MockCharacter, Herald, Herbalist, InfluenceDecoratingCharacter, Innkeeper, Messenger, MockCharacter, StudentStoreCharacter, TableTest.MockCharacter, Thief
public abstract class Character extends Object implements Jsonable
Represents an abstract character card. Each card has one "character", a cost that goes up by 1 after the first use and two hooks into respectively the PreparePhase and ActionPhase of the game. This base class has only default implementations that either do nothing, or throw an exception. Please see all subclasses for different card effects.
See Also:
  • ActionPhase
  • PreparePhase

    • getCost

      int getCost()
      Getter for this card's actual cost. This means that this will return the card's initial cost if this card hasn't been used before and the initial cos +1 otherwise.
      Returns:
      this card's actual cost

    • doPrepare

      Tuple<PreparePhase,Character> doPrepare(PreparePhase phase)
      Default implementation for the PreparePhase hook. This implementation only checks for nullity, so if subclasses want to not rewrite it themselves, they can call this implementation.
      Parameters:
      phase - the PreparePhase the card's hook has been called from
      Returns:
      a Tuple containing the updated PreparePhase and the updated Character
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if phase is null

    • doEffect

      Tuple<ActionPhase,Character> doEffect(ActionPhase phase, CharacterStep... steps) throws InvalidCharacterParameterException, InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Default implementation for the card's effect. This implementation only marks the card as used and checks for nullity of parameters. All subclasses should call this implementation if they are overriding this method.

      The number of steps and the parameters of each are detailed in each subclass. To signal that the player has not provided any steps, an empty array should be passed.

      Parameters:
      phase - the ActionPhase the card's effect has been called from
      steps - an array of CharacterStep configuring the effect
      Returns:
      a Tuple containing the updated ActionPhase and the updated Character
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if phase or steps or are null
      InvalidCharacterParameterException - if any of the parameters in steps is formatted incorrectly
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the effect of the card would modify the state in an illegal way

    • checkEffectParameters

      void checkEffectParameters(ActionPhase phase, CharacterStep[] steps) throws InvalidCharacterParameterException
      Helper for validating parameters in subclasses: check for nullity and length of the step array
      Parameters:
      phase - the ActionPhase to check
      steps - the CharacterStep array to check
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case of nullity
      InvalidCharacterParameterException - if the length of steps is less than minimumSteps

    • getNumOfBlocks

      int getNumOfBlocks()
      Returns the number of BlockCard available on this card. This implementation always returns 0 since block related methods always throw an exception.
      Returns:
      the number of BlockCard available on this card

    • pushBlock

      Character pushBlock(BlockCard block)
      Adds the given BlockCard to the internal store. This implementation of the method throws a UnsupportedOperationException.
      Parameters:
      block - the BlockCard to add to the store
      Returns:
      the updated Character
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always

    • popBlock

      Tuple<Character,BlockCard> popBlock()
      Pops a BlockCard from the internal store and returns it. This implementation of the method throws a UnsupportedOperationException.
      Returns:
      a Tuple containing the new Character and a BlockCard.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always
